intro: Ehretia exsucca, commonly known as the white thorn tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody, thorny stems and dense foliage of small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
